data.title: Last year's giveaway didn't go well.
data.meta_description: Here is what you saw on Good Day Alabama for June 14, 2013: JEH JEH LIVE - Jeh Jeh joined us live from Lifesouth Community Blood Center on West Oxmoor. Often during the summer, blood centers desperately
data.text:
Here is what you saw on Good Day Alabama for June 14, 2013:

JEH JEH LIVE - Jeh Jeh joined us live from Lifesouth Community Blood Center on West Oxmoor. Often during the summer, blood centers desperately need blood. LifeSouth Community Blood Centers is a community blood supplier for local hospitals in Alabama, Florida and Georgia. LifeSouth is committed to meeting the blood supply needs of these hospitals in each of the communities we serve by providing the highest quality blood components and services. LifeSouth Community Blood Centers is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. Each year, nearly five million Americans need a blood transfusion. To meet that responsibility, the blood centers need to collect 266,000 blood donations a year. That's 728 donors a day. For more information, call (205) 943-6000 or visit www.lifesouth.org.

BARGAIN MOM - Birmingham's Bargain Mom Christie Dedman joined us with deals for your family. She showed us two ways to save on Monster's University tickets. 1. Subway has Monsters University backpacks for the kids' meal with codes that could mean a free movie ticket to see the latest Disney flick. You will enter the special code at www.tickettofresh.com. You will then receive an email notifying you of a winning or losing code. 2. Collect Monsters U codes from specially marked Kellogg's products and earn a free movie ticket to see Monster's Inc University. https://www.kelloggsfamilyrewards.com and enter the codes. You'll need 6 codes for 1 movie ticket. Red Robin is joining forces with The Wolverine, premiering July 26. Now through June 30, guests that purchase a $25 limited edition The Wolverine gift card at participating Red RobinÂ® restaurants will receive a free movie ticket to see the film when they enter their gift card code at www.redrobin.com/movietix. Birmingham Zoo, McWane & Fresh Air Family Butterfly day at Birmingham Botanical Gardens, Saturday - Fresh Air Family will have a special butterfly event this Saturday. Here's what they tweeted: "Celebrate butterfly day with us this coming Saturday, June 15, at the Birmingham Botanical Gardens." Birmingham Zoo will host children's activities from 10 - 2 p.m., with butterfly releases scheduled for 11 a.m. and 1 p.m. McWane Science Center will also host children's activities from 10 - 2 p.m., and hold a drawing for free tickets to its latest feature, "Flight of the Butterflies." Fresh Air Family will host "Hikes for Tykes," a walk led by Verna Gates focusing on butterfly lore, legend and stories based on Monarch butterflies. The hike, designed for pre-school children and their parents, will begin at 10 a.m.

BBJ - Mike talks with Ryan Poe with the Birmingham Business Journal about local business headlines. They discussed why as a manufacturer, Royal Cup Coffee is bucking the trend in Alabama; With houses selling like hotcakes this year, how worried should metro Birmingham be about another housing bubble; and loans doled out to Alabama businesses through the U.S. Small Business Administration are down through the first seven months of the agency's fiscal year. For more on these and other business stories, visit www.birminghambusinessjournal.com.

GAMING - USA TODAY tech/gaming contributor Marc Saltzman showed us some of the hottest games and gadgets, perfect for summer travel, coming out of E3 - the Electronic Entertainment Expo. Marc revealed the latest gaming wars and some great tech tips for summer travel that will keep the family happy on the highway.

Marc previewed PlayStations "The Last of Us" survival game; Skylanders SWAP Force; the latest in wireless plus; Dell/Intel HD Ultrabook Convertible featuring a full HD screen, providing the Ultimate gaming experience; the all-new PS4; and other news coming from the show.

ZOO CREW - Kelly Wall joins us from the Birmingham Zoo to introduce Mickey to an alligator. To learn more information about the animal or visit the zoo, go to birminghamzoo.com.

COMEDIAN - Greg Morton has been described as having "an animated presence." Not surprising when you read his credentials. Greg worked as an animator on such shows as the Scooby and Scrappy Doo Show and the New Flintstone's. His voice-over talents can be heard on such shows as Robocop and Police Academy (the cartoon series). He has directed several Saturday morning cartoon hits including Hammerman (MC Hammer) and The Legend of White Fang for HBO. For tickets or more information for this weekend's appearances, call the Comedy Club Stardome at (205) 444-0008 or visit stardome.com.

CHEFS FOR THE CURE - Chefs for the Cure is next Thursday from 6-9pm at The Club. Chefs for the Cure is an exclusive tasting event that features an array of gourmet cuisine from some of Birmingham's finest chefs. Each chef will bring his or her unique flavor, style, and fare to their station at The Club. Enjoy signature dishes while bidding on silent auction items throughout the evening! The evening kicks-off with a cocktail reception at 6pm presented by Cathead Vodka and appetizers from Mafiaoza's, Sol Y Luna, Little Savannah, and Satterfield's. Then progress through the entrees from John's City Diner, Homewood Gourmet, The J. Clyde, and Ocean. Finish the night with desserts from Ted's Restaurant and The Culinard. Each chef prepares their signature dish directly in front of the guests, making this event a wonderful way to interact with your favorite restaurants. You can also check out the silent auction with something for everyone - from vacations to packages from local merchants and activities to do in and around the Birmingham area - and enjoy the view of the city from The Club's patio and live jazz by "One for the Road". Ticket are $100 each or two for $150. Tickets include gourmet tastings from 10 participating chefs, complimentary wine and beer, 1 raffle ticket, and swag bag. For more information, call (205) 263-1700 or visit http://www.komenncalabama.org/get-involved/chefs-for-the-cure
